page.title: 17DURRINGTON-ITS PASTOR'S VIEW
page.content: To all outward appearances,Durrington is a sedate,predominantly retired community to the North-West of Worthing,sitting snugly in the lie of the Downs.Despite its absorption into the Greater Worthing Area,Durrington retains some of its identity and village atmosphere,adding to the picture of serenity and peace. Beneath the image,however,all is not well with Durrington.Its people are caught in the dangers of the age.All too many families are hiding,breaking hearts and relationships beneath the veneer of respectability.Husbands and wives,parents and children failing to find love and fulfillness used to their own pursuits of happiness.The result? A community where family life is,for all too many,breaking down.Hope for Durrington lies in the church's age-old message of reconciliation.
